page.title: 06** HOLY TRINITY CHURCH ***
page.content: The Parish church of S.Hetton which stands to the West of the main road through the village was built in 1838 and has been extended three times since that date. The church is built of local sandstone and has a timber and slate roof. It seats 350 persons and conducts daily services. It stands in a large churchyard which contains the graves of miners killed in the Haswell Mine disaster which occurred in 1844. Plans are being developed to build a new church hall to complement the recently constructed vicarage. A fund has been founded for this purpose which is at present Â£25,000 short of it's target. Activities connected with the church include choir,Mothers union and Ladies Circle.
